datasetStructure: One record per medical history event per subject

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: MHSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: MHGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHREFID

datasetVariables.description: Internal or external medical history identifier.
datasetVariables.label: Reference ID
datasetVariables.name: MHREFID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a Medical History page.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: MHSPID

datasetVariables.name: MHTERM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHMODIFY

datasetVariables.description: If MHTERM is modified to facilitate coding, then MHMODIFY will contain the modified text.
datasetVariables.label: Modified Reported Term
datasetVariables.name: MHMODIFY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHDECOD

datasetVariables.description: Dictionary-derived text description of MHTERM or MHMODIFY. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes.
datasetVariables.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
datasetVariables.name: MHDECOD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: CARDIAC or GENERAL
datasetVariables.label: Category for Medical History
datasetVariables.name: MHCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHSCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of the condition or event.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Medical History
datasetVariables.name: MHSCAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHPRESP

datasetVariables.description: A value of "Y" indicates that this medical history event was pre-specified on the CRF. Values are null for spontaneously reported events (i.e., those collected as free-text verbatim terms)
datasetVariables.label: Medical History Event Pre-Specified
datasetVariables.name: MHPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHOCCUR

datasetVariables.description: Used when the occurrence of specific medical history conditions is solicited to indicate whether or not (Y/N) a medical condition (MHTERM) had ever occurred. Values are null for spontaneously reported events.
datasetVariables.label: Medical History Occurrence
datasetVariables.name: MHOCCUR

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHSTAT

datasetVariables.description: The status indicates that the pre-specified question was not asked/answered.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: MHSTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHREASND

self.title: Reason Medical History Not Done or Not Occurred

datasetVariables.description: Reason the question was not asked/answered or an intervention did not occur. Used in conjunction with negation indicators --STAT of 'NOT DONE' or --OCCUR of 'N'
datasetVariables.label: Reason Medical History Not Done or Not Occurred
datasetVariables.name: MHREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHBODSYS

datasetVariables.description: Dictionary-derived. Body system or organ class that is involved in an event or measurement from a standard hierarchy (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.
datasetVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class
datasetVariables.name: MHBODSYS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHDY

datasetVariables.name: MHDY

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66728

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHENRF

datasetVariables.description: Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics)
datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariables.name: MHENRF

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariables.description: Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable MHENTPT.
datasetVariables.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: MHENRTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable MH.MHENTPT

datasetVariables.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by MHENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
datasetVariables.label: End Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: MHENTPT

description: An events domain that contains data that includes the subject's prior medical history at the start of the trial. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49603, 2018-06-29)
label: Medical History
name: MH
